en: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
hmr: Amoz naupa Isaiin Judahai lal Uzzia, Jotham, Ahaz le Hezekia hai inlal laia Judahai le Jerusalem chungchâng thua inlârna a hmu chu.

en: Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth; for Jehovah hath spoken: I have nourished and brought up children, and they have rebelled against me.
hmr: Aw vânhai, ngai unla, aw lei- hnuoi, na sit rawh, LALPA chun thu a hril ie: “Nauhai chu ka châwm puitling a, ka chungah an hel ta sih a.

en: The ox knoweth his owner, and the ass his master’s crib; but Israel doth not know, my people doth not consider.
hmr: Bâwngchal chun a pu a hriet a, sabengtung khawma a pu bupêkna a hriet bawk a, Israelhai ruok chun an hriet si nawh a; ka mihai chun an ngaituo naw a nih,” tiin.

en: Ah sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a seed of evil-doers, children that deal corruptly! they have forsaken Jehovah, they have despised the Holy One of Israel, they are estranged and gone backward.
hmr: A! hnam suol, khawhlona riktak phur mihai, chithla thil ṭha naw thaw- tuhai, nau rilotaka khawsa hlakhai an nih. LALPA chu an mâksan a, Israelhai Mi Inthieng chu an hmusit a, insuktumin an hnungtawl tah.

en: Why will ye be still stricken, that ye revolt more and more? the whole head is sick, and the whole heart faint.
hmr: Iengdinga hel zuol deu deu a, vuoka la um rawp ding am in nih a? Lu chu a pumin a nah a, lungril khawm chu a pumin a châu tah.

en: From the sole of the foot even unto the head there is no soundness in it; but wounds, and bruises, and fresh stripes: they have not been closed, neither bound up, neither mollified with oil.
hmr: Kepha hnuoia inthawka lu chenin a dam lai hrim a um nawh; pawp dâm, vuok duk chur dâm, pânna hnâi la ruok an nih; chuong chu an hmetping nawh a, an tuom bawk nawh a, sahriek khawm an nâl bawk nawh.

en: Your country is desolate; your cities are burned with fire; your land, strangers devour it in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.
hmr: In ram chu rausanin a um zo a, in khuohai chu meiin a kâng zo a, in ram chu ram dang mihaiin in mithmu ngeiah an nei zo a, ram dang mihai suksiet angin a se zo tah.

en: And the daughter of Zion is left as a booth in a vineyard, as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city.
hmr: Zion naunu chu grêp huona vêngbûk ang le, fanghma huona ṭu ang le, khawpui inhuolvêl anga mâksanin a um tah.

en: Except Jehovah of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, we should have been like unto Gomorrah.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun hlabîkhai tlâwmte mi lo hlapêk naw sienla chu Sodom ang khan um dai tâng ei ta, Gomorra ang el khan um tâng ei tih.

en: Hear the word of Jehovah, ye rulers of Sodom; give ear unto the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah.
hmr: Sodom rorêltuhai, LALPA thu hi hre unla, Gomorra mihai, ei Pathien dân thua hin na sit ro!

en: What unto me is the multitude of your sacrifices? saith Jehovah: I have had enough of the burnt-offerings of rams, and the fat of fed beasts; and I delight not in the blood of bullocks, or of lambs, or of he-goats.
hmr: LALPA chun, “In inthâwina zozai hi ka ta dingin ieng am a ṭhang- kaina a um a? Berâmchal pumraw- hmanga inhlân le, ran châwm thâu- hai thâu chu ka nghawk tah; bâwng- chalhai le berâmte le kêlchalhai thisena hin ka lâwm ta nawh.

en: When ye come to appear before me, who hath required this at your hand, to trample my courts?
hmr: Ka hmaa hin inlang dinga in hung hin, ka biekin inhuon sûng tuollai hi sir dingin tuin am a phût cheu a?

en: Bring no more vain oblations; incense is an abomination unto me; new moon and sabbath, the calling of assemblies,—I cannot away with iniquity and the solemn meeting.
hmr: Thilpêk mei meihai chu hung chawi ta ngai naw ro; thil riminhnik khawm chu ka ta dingin thil tirdak- umtak a nih; thla thar dâm, châwlni dâm inkhâwmpuia infiel khâwm dâm mei mei chu ka ngai thei naw tawp el; khawhlona mei mei a nih, inkhâwm ropuitak khawm hi.

en: Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth; they are a trouble unto me; I am weary of bearing them.
hmr: In thla tharhai le in hunbi nei ruoiṭhehai chu ka lungril chun a theida a nih; ka ta dinga thil hnawk- saktak a nih, tuor ka nghawk tah a nih.

en: And when ye spread forth your hands, I will hide mine eyes from you; yea, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear: your hands are full of blood.
hmr: Chuongchun, in kut in phar pha khawm in tienga chun ka hmai hip tâng ka ta, anih, vawi tamtak in ṭawngṭai hnung khawmin ngai ta naw ningah; in kuthai chu thisenin a sip sih a.

en: Wash you, make you clean; put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes; cease to do evil;
hmr: Insâwp unla, insukfai ro, ka mithmu phâk nawah in thilthawhai hi a suolna chu sie hmang ro; suol thaw thaw el hi ma ta unla, thil ṭha thaw inchûk ta ro;

en: learn to do well; seek justice, relieve the oppressed, judge the fatherless, plead for the widow.
hmr: rorêlna fel zawng unla, nêk- sâwrna tuorhai chu ṭhangpui unla, pa bohai chu ro rêlpêk unla, hmeithaihai chu hrilpui ro,” ti hi.

en: Come now, and let us reason together, saith Jehovah: though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.
hmr: LALPA chun, “Hung ta u, ngaituo tlâng ei tiu! In suolhai chu sen inlâr angin um ta sienla khawm, vûr angin vâr a tih; sen duk angin sen ta sienla khawm, berâm hmul angin um a tih.

en: If ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat the good of the land:
hmr: Tiâwitak le thuâwitaka in um chun, in rama thil ṭhahai hi fâng in ta;

en: but if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the sword; for the mouth of Jehovah hath spoken it.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, in nuom nawh a, in hel chun kâwlhnâmin fa zo a ti cheu; LALPA bau chun chu chu a hril tah a nih,” a ta.

en: How is the faithful city become a harlot! she that was full of justice! righteousness lodged in her, but now murderers.
hmr: Iengtiziea khawpui ringumtak chu nawchizawra inchang el am a ni le aw! Rorêl felnaa sipnu a ni hlak vei leh! Amaa chun felna a um hlak a, tu ruok hin chu tuolthattuhai an um lem ta hi.

en: Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water.
hmr: I tangka chu a êksiein ân chang tah a, i uoin chu tui le pawl a ni tah a.

en: Thy princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves; every one loveth bribes, and followeth after rewards: they judge not the fatherless, neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them.
hmr: I mi lienhai chu mi hel hmang, inru hmanghai ruolhai an nih, mi tinin tham an nuom a, lâwmman an hnawt hlak; pa bohai ro an rêlpêk ngai nawh a, hmeithai thu hlak an kuom a tlung ngai nawh.

en: Therefore saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, the Mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies;
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA, Sipaihai LALPA, Israelhai Mi Hrât chun, hieng ang hin a hril a nih: “A! A mi dotuhai hi sukfithla el ka ta, ka hmêl- mahai chungah phuba lâng ka tih:

en: and I will turn my hand upon thee, and thoroughly purge away thy dross, and will take away all thy tin;
hmr: chun, i chungah ka kut thlâk nâwk ka ta, i êksie chu faitakin sukbo ka ta, i suon po po chu la hmang vawng ka tih:

en: and I will restore thy judges as at the first, and thy counsellors as at the beginning: afterward thou shalt be called The city of righteousness, a faithful town.
hmr: chun, i chungah rorêltuhai chu a tîra an um ang khan inumtir nâwk ka ta, i sûnga remruottuhai chu a hmasa taka an um ang khan inumtir nâwk bawk ka tih; chu hnunga chun, ‘Felna khawpui, khawpui ringumtak,’ la tîng an ti che.

en: Zion shall be redeemed with justice, and her converts with righteousness.
hmr: Zion chu rorêlna fela sansuok ni tâng a ta, a sûnga mi nghakîr nâwkhai khawm felnaa sansuok nîng an tih.

en: But the destruction of transgressors and sinners shall be together, and they that forsake Jehovah shall be consumed.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, bawsetuhai le mi suolhai suksietna chu um inruol a ta, LALPA mâksantuhai khawm sukbohmangin um an tih.

en: For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired, and ye shall be confounded for the gardens that ye have chosen.
hmr: In thingsaisuo dittakhai chu inzâpui tâng an ta, in huon thlanghai lei chun inzaktakin in um ta ding a nih.

en: For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden that hath no water.
hmr: Thingsaisuo a hna vuoi ta le, huon tui hmu naw ang el hi in ni ding a nih.

en: And the strong shall be as tow, and his work as a spark; and they shall both burn together, and none shall quench them.
hmr: Chun, mi hrâttak chu ziza pawn ang ni tâng a ta, a sinthaw chu meisi ang ni tâng a tih; chuongchun, kâng rêl an ta, tukhawma sukrêm naw ni hai,” tiin.
